title: Using Rotenone Plants to Poison Fish
brief: Use specific plants containing rotenone to stun fish in ponds and streams without harming their edibility.
steps: Step 1: Identify suitable water - ponds or headwaters of small streams containing fish.
Step 2: Ensure water temperature is 21Â°C (70Â°F) or above for best results.
Step 3: Crush rotenone-containing plant parts (seeds, roots, bark, or leaves depending on species).
Step 4: Throw crushed plant material into the water.
Step 5: Wait for fish to rise helplessly to the surface.
Step 6: Collect ALL affected fish immediately to avoid arousing suspicion downstream.
warnings: Works slowly in water 10-21Â°C (50-70Â°F) and is ineffective below 10Â°C (50Â°F).
Must collect all dead fish to prevent detection by others downstream.
Only use plants you can positively identify as rotenone-containing species.
